snippet: Since Russia annexed the Black Sea peninsula 10 months ago, more than $1 billion in assets and real estate have been stripped from their owners and claimed by the Crimean government.
abstract: Thousands of business owners have had their property seized by government since Crimea's unification with Russia 10 months ago; Crimean government declares such takeovers, which total more than $1 billion in real estate value to date, to be nationalizations.

byline.contributor: Olga Rudenko contributed reporting from Kiev, Ukraine, and Alexandra Odynova from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Since Russia annexed the Black Sea peninsula 10 months ago, more than $1 billion in assets and real estate have been stripped from their owners and claimed by the Crimean government.

headline.main: Seizing Assets in Crimea, From Shipyard to Film Studio
headline.print_headline: Seizing Assets in Crimea, From Shipyard to Film Studio
